note.p: Industrialist and poultry fancier. Son of John Henry Vivian (1785–1855; ODNB), copper smelter, of Singleton Abbey, Swansea, South Wales. Introduced fancy breeds of poultry, including Polands and crève-coeurs, to Britain from Europe in the 1850s. Created an estate at Clyne Castle, Swansea, from the 1860s.
